member.name: M:FluentAssertions.Verification.Verify(System.Func{System.Boolean},System.String,System.Object,System.Object,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Asserts that the supplied is met.
member.param: The condition to assert

The message that will be used in the . This should describe what was expected and why. This message should contain the following 3 placeholders:
{0} = expected value
{1} = actual value
{2} = the reason for the expectation
The expected value, or null if there is no explicit expected value
The actual value, or null if there is no explicit actual value
Should describe the reason for the expectation
Optional parameters for the

example.code: Verification.Verify(() => value == 0, "Expected value to be <{0}>{2}, but found <{1}>", expected, reason, reasonParameters);

member.name: M:FluentAssertions.Verification.Verify(System.Action,System.String,System.Object,System.Object,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Asserts that the supplied does not throw any .
member.param: The to perform

The message that will be used in the . This should describe what was expected and why. This message can contain the following placeholder:
{2} = the reason for the expectation
The expected value, or null if there is no explicit expected value
The actual value, or null if there is no explicit actual value
Should describe the reason for the expectation
Optional parameters for the

example.code: Verification.Verify(() => value == 0, "Expected value to be positive{2}, but found <{1}>", reason, reasonParameters);

member.name: M:FluentAssertions.Verification.Verify(System.Boolean,System.String,System.Object,System.Object,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Asserts that the supplied is true.

The message that will be used in the . This should describe what was expected and why. This message should contain the following 3 placeholders:
{0} = expected value
{1} = actual value
{2} = the reason for the expectation
The expected value
The actual value
Should describe the reason for the expectation
Optional parameters for the

example.code: Verification.Verify(() => value == 0, "Expected value to be <{0}>{2}, but found <{1}>", expected, reason, reasonParameters);
